00020 /*
00021  * \file tsv-example.cpp
00022  * \brief This program is provided as an example of using TsvFile.
00023  *        You should be able to find a common uses of TsvFile here
00024  *        to use as a starting point in your programs.
00025  *        Read \link file-format-tsv the TsvFile docs \endlink more about TsvFile.
00026  */
00027

00050 
00053 void
00054 example_walk_clf(std::string file_name)
00055 {
00056   printf("=== example walk clf ====================\n");
00057 
00058   int rv;
00059   affx::ClfFile clf;
00060 
00061   clf.m_tsv.m_optAbortOnError=false; // this should be true in real code.
00062 
00063   if ((rv=clf.open(file_name))!=TSV_OK) {
00064     printf("open of '%s' failed! (rv=%d)\n",file_name.c_str(),rv);
00065     return;
00066   }
00067 
00068   int cnt_probe=0;
00069   while (clf.next_probe()==TSV_OK) {
00070     cnt_probe++;
00071   }
00072   printf("'%s' has %d probes\n",file_name.c_str(),cnt_probe);
00073 }
00074 
00076 
00079 void
00080 example_walk_pgf(std::string file_name)
00081 {
00082   printf("=== example walk pgf ====================\n");
00083 
00084   int rv;
00085   affx::PgfFile* pgf;
00086 
00087   pgf=new affx::PgfFile();
00088   pgf->m_tsv.m_optAbortOnError=false; // this should be true in real code.
00089   if ((rv=pgf->open(file_name))!=TSV_OK) {
00090     printf("open of '%s' failed! (rv=%d)\n",file_name.c_str(),rv);
00091     delete pgf;
00092     return;
00093   }
00094 
00095   int cnt_probeset=0;
00096   int cnt_atoms=0;
00097   int cnt_probes=0;
00098   while (pgf->next_probeset()==TSV_OK) {
00099     cnt_probeset++;
00100     while (pgf->next_atom()==TSV_OK) {
00101       cnt_atoms++;
00102       while (pgf->next_probe()==TSV_OK) {
00103         cnt_probes++;
00104       }
00105     }
00106   }
00107   printf("read '%s' with %d probesets, %d atoms, %d probes.\n",
00108          file_name.c_str(),cnt_probeset,cnt_atoms,cnt_probes);
00109 
00110   pgf->close();
00111   delete pgf;
00112 }

00115 
00118 void
00119 example_index_1(std::string file_name)
00120 {
00121   printf("=== example index 1 ====================\n");
00122 
00123   int rv;
00124   affx::TsvFile* tsv;
00125 
00126   int match_cnt=0;
00127   int match_print_max=20; // dont print more than this.
00128   std::string match_seq;
00129   int match_gc=0;
00130   int query_gc;
00131   char* opstr="??";
00132 
00133   //
00134   tsv=new affx::TsvFile();
00135   if ((rv=tsv->open(file_name))!=TSV_OK) {
00136     printf("open of '%s' failed! (rv=%d)\n",file_name.c_str(),rv);
00137     delete tsv;
00138     return;
00139   }
00140 
00141   // we need an index
00142   tsv->defineIndex(2,"gc_count",TSV_INDEX_INT,0);
00143 
00144   // start the search
00145   tsv->findBegin(2,"gc_count",TSV_OP_LTEQ,query_gc=7,TSV_ORDERBY_VAL); opstr="<=";
00146   // tsv->findBegin(2,"gc_count",TSV_OP_GTEQ,query_gc=18,TSV_ORDERBY_VAL); opstr=">=";
00147   // tsv->findBegin(2,"gc_count",TSV_OP_EQ,query_gc=11,TSV_ORDERBY_VAL); opstr="==";
00148   // tsv->dump_indexes();
00149 
00150   //
00151   printf("searching for probes (gc_cnt %s %d) ==========\n",opstr,query_gc);
00152   printf("hit | line    | seq                       | gc \n");
00153   printf("----+---------+---------------------------+----\n");
00154   while (tsv->findNext()==TSV_OK) {
00155     match_cnt++;
00156     tsv->get(2,"probe_sequence",match_seq);
00157     tsv->get(2,"gc_count",match_gc);
00158     
00159     if (opt_verbose>0) {
00160       if (match_cnt<match_print_max) {
00161         printf("%3d | %7u | %-25s | %4d\n",
00162                match_cnt,tsv->lineNumber(),match_seq.c_str(),match_gc);
00163       }
00164       else if (match_cnt==match_print_max) {
00165         printf("first %d matches printed; skipping remaining matches...\n",match_print_max);
00166       }
00167     }
00168   }
00169   printf("=== %6d probes with gc_count %s %4d\n",match_cnt,opstr,query_gc);
00170   //
00171   tsv->close();
00172   delete tsv;
00173 }

00175 
00178 void
00179 example_index_2(std::string file_name)
00180 {
00181   printf("=== example index 2 ====================\n");
00182 
00183   affx::PgfFile pgf;
00184   std::string query_seq="GTTTCTTATACGCTTACTTCGACAA";
00185 
00186   printf("searching for probes matching '%s'...\n",query_seq.c_str());
00187 
00188   pgf.open(file_name);
00189   pgf.m_tsv.defineIndex(2,"probe_sequence",TSV_INDEX_STRING,0);
00190   pgf.m_tsv.findBegin(2,"probe_sequence",TSV_OP_EQ,query_seq);
00191   //
00192   printf("result count: %d \n",pgf.m_tsv.findResultsCount());
00193   while (pgf.m_tsv.findNext()==TSV_OK) {
00194     if (opt_verbose>0) {
00195       printf("%5d : %10d : %-30s\n",pgf.m_tsv.lineNumber(),pgf.probe_id,pgf.probe_sequence.c_str());
00196     }
00197   }
00198 }
00199 
00202 void
00203 example_write_1(std::string  file_name)
00204 {
00205   affx::TsvFile tsv;
00206 
00207   // two keys with different values.
00208   // Add all your keys before calling "writeTsv".
00209   tsv.addHeader("Example","This an example header. (1)");
00210   tsv.addHeader("Example","This an example header. (2)");
00211   // why? because "headerN" is a reserved key.
00212   tsv.addHeader("header0","this should not appear in the output");
00213   // "header_whatever" isnt
00214   tsv.addHeader("header_test","this should appear in the output");
00215   // The "%6.2" might be used in the future.
00216   // for now the format info is ignored.
00217   tsv.defineFile("col00\tcol01\tcol02\n"
00218                  "col10\tcol11\tcol12\tcol13\n"
00219                  "col20,string\tcol21,integer\tcol22,float,%6.2f\tcol23\tcol24\n");
00220 
00221   tsv.writeTsv(file_name);
00222   // keys added after here are still added, but wont appear in the output...
00223   // ...the header has been written already.
00224 
00225   // Stuff data into the levels and columns and write it out.
00226   int cnt=0;
00227   int r0_reps=3; // count of topmost lines
00228   int rN_reps=6; // count of inner most lines
00229   for (int r0=0;r0<r0_reps;r0++) {
00230     for (int clvl=0;clvl<tsv.getLevelCount();clvl++) {
00231       for (int rN=0;rN<((clvl<(tsv.getLevelCount()-1)?1:rN_reps));rN++) {
00232         for (int cidx=0;cidx<tsv.getColumnCount(clvl);cidx++) {
00233           tsv.set(clvl,cidx,cnt++);
00234         }
00235         tsv.writeLevel(clvl);
00236       }
00237     }
00238   }
00239 
00240   tsv.close();
00241 }

00247 void
00248 example_write_2(std::string file_name)
00249 {
00250   affx::PgfFile pgf;
00251 
00252   pgf.defineFilePgf();
00253   pgf.m_tsv.addHeader("Note","Add headers before writing!");
00254   pgf.m_tsv.addHeader("Note","Adding headers later doesnt put them in the file.");
00255   pgf.m_tsv.addHeader("Example-02","Feel free to delete it.");
00256   pgf.m_tsv.addHeader("Example-01","This is an example file.");
00257   pgf.write(file_name);
00258   // write one probe
00259   pgf.m_tsv.set(0,"probeset_id"  ,1354897);
00260   pgf.m_tsv.set(0,"probeset_name","204339_s_at");
00261   pgf.m_tsv.writeLevel(0);
00262   //
00263   pgf.m_tsv.set(1,"atom_id",1354898);
00264   pgf.m_tsv.writeLevel(1);
00265         //
00266   pgf.m_tsv.set(2,"probe_id"              ,1221821);
00267   pgf.m_tsv.set(2,"type"                  ,"pm:target->at");
00268   pgf.m_tsv.set(2,"gc_count"              ,13);
00269   pgf.m_tsv.set(2,"probe_length"          ,25);
00270   pgf.m_tsv.set(2,"interrogation_position",13);
00271   pgf.m_tsv.set(2,"probe_sequence"        ,"ACAACGACCGTTCCGGAATCGACAT");
00272   pgf.m_tsv.set(2,"exon_position"         ,1703);
00273   pgf.m_tsv.writeLevel(2);
00274   //
00275   pgf.m_tsv.close();
00276 }

00283 void
00284 example_write_3(std::string file_name,int fmt)
00285 {
00286   affx::TsvFile tsv;
00287 
00288   tsv.defineFile("col00\tcol01\tcol02\tcol03");
00289   tsv.addHeader("Note","This is example output");
00290 
00291   //tsv.dump_headers();
00292 
00293   if (fmt==1) {
00294     tsv.writeTsv_v1(file_name);
00295   } else if (fmt==2) {
00296     tsv.writeCsv(file_name);
00297   } else {
00298     assert(0);
00299   }
00300 
00301   int cnt=0;
00302   for (int i=0;i<100;i++) {
00303     tsv.set(0,"col00",cnt++);
00304     tsv.set(0,"col01",cnt++);
00305     tsv.set(0,"col02",cnt++);
00306     tsv.set(0,"col03",cnt++);
00307     tsv.writeLevel(0);
00308   }
00309   tsv.close();
00310 }
00311 
00316 void
00317 example_write_4(std::string file_name,int row_cnt,int col_cnt)
00318 {
00319   affx::TsvFile tsv;
00320   char string_buf[100];
00321 
00322   snprintf(string_buf,sizeof(string_buf),
00323            "'%s' %d rows, %d cols",
00324            file_name.c_str(),row_cnt,col_cnt);
00325   tsv.addHeader("Note",string_buf);
00326 
00327   for (int c=0;c<col_cnt;c++) {
00328     snprintf(string_buf,sizeof(string_buf),"col%03d",c);
00329     tsv.defineColumn(0,c,string_buf);
00330     tsv.setPrecision(0,c,c+1);
00331   }
00332 
00333   tsv.writeTsv(file_name);
00334 
00335   int i=0;
00336   for (int r=0;r<row_cnt;r++) {
00337     for (int c=0;c<col_cnt;c++) {
00338       tsv.set(0,c,(i++)+0.1234);
00339     }
00340     tsv.writeLevel(0);
00341   }
00342   tsv.close();
00343 }

00346 
00349 void
00350 example_read_table_1(std::string file_name)
00351 {
00352   affx::TsvFile tsv;
00353 
00354   printf("=== example table read ====================\n");
00355 
00356   tsv.openTable(file_name);
00357 
00358   while (tsv.nextLevel(0)==TSV_OK) {
00359     int cidx=0;
00360     string colstr;
00361     while ((cidx<tsv.getColumnCount(tsv.lineLevel())) &&
00362            (tsv.get(tsv.lineLevel(),cidx,colstr)==TSV_OK)) {
00363       if (cidx>0) {
00364         printf("\t");
00365       }
00366       printf("%s",colstr.c_str());
00367       cidx++;
00368     }
00369     printf("\n");
00370   }
00371   tsv.close();
00372 }
00373 
00376 void
00377 example_dump_columns(std::string file_name)
00378 {
00379   affx::TsvFile tsv;
00380   int rv;
00381 
00382   printf("=== example column dump: %s ====================\n",file_name.c_str());
00383   
00384   rv=tsv.openTable(file_name);
00385   assert(rv==TSV_OK);
00386 
00387   int clvl_max=tsv.getLevelCount();
00388   for (int clvl=0;clvl<clvl_max;clvl++) {
00389     int cidx_max=tsv.getColumnCount(clvl);
00390     for (int cidx=0;cidx<cidx_max;cidx++) {
00391       std::string cname;
00392       rv=tsv.cidx2cname(clvl,cidx,cname);
00393       assert(rv==TSV_OK);
00394       printf("%3d : %3d : %s\n",clvl,cidx,cname.c_str());
00395     }
00396   }
00397   tsv.close();
00398 
00399   printf("\n");
00400 }

00403 
00405 void
00406 usage()
00407 {
00408   printf(
00409          "\n"
00410          "usage: tsv-example [-b] testfilename.pgf\n"
00411          "\n"
00412          "   This is an example of common usage of TsvFile.\n"
00413          "   It checks that the file is of the correct type and\n"
00414          "   scans through it, indexes it and does some searching.\n"
00415          "\n"
00416          "   The '-b' flag suppresses some of the output so the time reflect\n"
00417          "   running time not printing time.\n"
00418          "\n"
00419          );
00420 }

00426 int
00427 main(int argc,char* argv[])
00428 {
00429   char** arg_next;
00430 
00431   //
00432   opt_benchmark=0;
00433   opt_verbose=1;
00434 
00435   //
00436   arg_next=argv;
00437   arg_next++;
00438   if ((*arg_next!=NULL)&&(strcmp(*arg_next,"-h")==0)) {
00439     usage();
00440     exit(0);
00441   }
00442   if ((*arg_next!=NULL)&&(strcmp(*arg_next,"-b")==0)) {
00443     opt_benchmark=1;
00444     opt_verbose=0;
00445     printf("=== benchmarking mode...\n");
00446     arg_next++;
00447   }
00448   if (*arg_next==NULL) {
00449     usage();
00450     exit(0);
00451   }
00452 
00453   // people dont like bad format messages
00454   // example_walk_clf(*arg_next);
00455 
00456   // walk a pgf
00457 
00458   example_walk_pgf(*arg_next);
00459 
00460   // a couple times for profiling
00461   if (0) {
00462     for (int i=0;i<2;i++) {
00463       printf("=== %3d: ",i);
00464       example_walk_pgf(*arg_next);
00465     }
00466   }
00467 
00468   //
00469   example_index_1(*arg_next);
00470   example_index_2(*arg_next);
00471   //
00472   example_write_1("example-write-1.tsv");
00473   example_write_2("example-write-2.pgf");
00474   //
00475   example_write_3("example-write-3.tsv",1);
00476   example_write_3("example-write-3.csv",2);
00477 
00478   // commented out as this writes a big file.
00479   // example_write_4("/var/tmp/example-write-4.tsv",1000000,5);
00480 
00481   //
00482   example_read_table_1("data-table-1.txt");
00483   //
00484   example_dump_columns(*arg_next);
00485 
00486   //
00487   printf("=== done ===\n");
00488 
00489   return 0;
00490 }
